section.title: Builtin Key and Mouse Bindings
section.para: The following commands are built-in to fvwm:
section.programlisting: Help R A MenuFvwmRoot F1 R A MenuFvwmRoot Tab A M Root c c NoDeskSort Escape A MC 1 R A MenuFvwmRoot 1 T A FuncFvwmRaiseLowerX 1 FS A FuncFvwmRaiseLowerX 2 FST A FuncFvwmRaiseLowerX FuncFvwmRaiseLowerX + I + M $0 + D
section.para: The Help and F1 keys invoke a built-in menu that fvwm creates. This is primarily for new users that have not created their own configuration file. Either key on the root (background) window pops up an menu to help you get started.
The Tab key pressed anywhere with the Meta key (same as the Alt key on PC keyboards) held down pop-ups a window list.
Mouse button 1 on the title-bar or side frame can move, raise or lower a window.
Mouse button 1 on the window corners can resize, raise or lower a window.
